title: Acts Chapter 6 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Acts chapter 6 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Acts Chapter 6 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Acts Chapter 6.

questions.question: Why did the murmuring arise among the Grecians against the Hebrews?
options: Because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration
Because they were not allowed to pray
Because they disagreed about the word of God
questions.correctAnswer: Because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration
questions.explanation: Acts 6:1 states that the murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews was because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.

questions.question: What did the twelve apostles say they should not leave to serve tables?
questions.correctAnswer: The word of God
questions.explanation: Acts 6:2 explains that the twelve said it is not reasonable to leave the word of God to serve tables.

questions.question: How many men did the apostles ask the disciples to choose to serve?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven
questions.explanation: Acts 6:3 says the apostles asked the disciples to choose seven men of honest report to serve.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The apostles said they would give themselves continually to ______ and to the ministry of the word.
questions.correctAnswer: prayer
questions.explanation: Acts 6:4 states the apostles would give themselves continually to prayer and the ministry of the word.

questions.question: Who was chosen as one of the seven men to serve, described as full of faith and the Holy Ghost?
questions.correctAnswer: Stephen
questions.explanation: Acts 6:5 names Stephen as a man full of faith and the Holy Ghost chosen among the seven.

questions.question: What did the apostles do after the seven men were chosen?
options: Prayed and laid hands on them
questions.correctAnswer: Prayed and laid hands on them
questions.explanation: Acts 6:6 says that the apostles prayed and laid their hands on the seven men.

questions.question: What happened to the word of God and the number of disciples after the appointment of the seven?
options: The word of God increased and the number of disciples multiplied greatly
The word of God stopped and the number of disciples decreased
The word of God remained the same but the disciples left
The word of God was ignored
questions.correctAnswer: The word of God increased and the number of disciples multiplied greatly
questions.explanation: Acts 6:7 explains that the word of God increased and the number of disciples multiplied greatly in Jerusalem.

questions.question: True or False: Stephen performed great wonders and miracles among the people.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 6:8 confirms that Stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonders and miracles among the people.

questions.question: Which groups disputed with Stephen in the synagogue?
options: Libertines, Cyrenians, Alexandrians, and those of Cilicia and Asia
questions.correctAnswer: Libertines, Cyrenians, Alexandrians, and those of Cilicia and Asia
questions.explanation: Acts 6:9 mentions these specific groups disputing with Stephen in the synagogue.

questions.question: True or False: The people disputing with Stephen were able to resist the wisdom and spirit by which he spoke.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 6:10 states they were not able to resist the wisdom and spirit by which Stephen spoke.

questions.question: What false accusation was made against Stephen by the suborned men?
options: That he spoke blasphemous words against Moses and God
That he stole from the temple
questions.correctAnswer: That he spoke blasphemous words against Moses and God
questions.explanation: Acts 6:11 records that men said Stephen spoke blasphemous words against Moses and God.

questions.question: Who was stirred up to seize Stephen and bring him to the council?
questions.correctAnswer: The people, elders, and scribes
questions.explanation: Acts 6:12 states the people, elders, and scribes were stirred up and brought Stephen to the council.

questions.question: True or False: False witnesses claimed Stephen said Jesus would destroy the holy place and change the customs given by Moses.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 6:13-14 details the false witnesses' claims that Stephen said Jesus of Nazareth would destroy the holy place and change Moses' customs.

questions.question: What did those sitting in the council see when they looked steadily at Stephen?
options: His face was like the face of an angel
questions.correctAnswer: His face was like the face of an angel
questions.explanation: Acts 6:15 says the council saw Stephen's face as it had been the face of an angel.

questions.question: Who among the chosen seven was a proselyte of Antioch?
questions.correctAnswer: Nicolas
questions.explanation: Acts 6:5 identifies Nicolas as a proselyte of Antioch among the seven chosen.

medium.title: Acts Chapter 6 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Acts Chapter 6 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Acts 6 teach us about the importance of delegation and serving others in the church?
options: Leaders should handle all tasks personally
Delegation helps maintain focus on prayer and the ministry of the word
Only the apostles can serve tables
Ministry tasks should be ignored for growth
questions.correctAnswer: Delegation helps maintain focus on prayer and the ministry of the word
questions.explanation: Acts 6:2-4 shows the apostles choosing others to serve tables so they can focus on prayer and preaching, teaching us the value of delegation to serve effectively.

questions.question: According to Acts 6, what qualities should we look for in those who serve in church ministries?
options: Honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom
questions.explanation: Acts 6:3 emphasizes selecting men of good reputation, full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom, highlighting the importance of integrity and spiritual maturity in service.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with balancing prayer and practical service. What biblical principle from Acts 6 would you share?
options: Prayer is less important than service
Prayer and ministry of the word should be a priority, while others handle practical needs
Service should be avoided for prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer and ministry of the word should be a priority, while others handle practical needs
questions.explanation: Acts 6:4 shows the apostles prioritizing prayer and ministry of the word, delegating practical tasks to others, teaching balance in spiritual and practical duties.

questions.question: What does the selection of Stephen and others in Acts 6 teach about integrity and faith in Christian service?
options: Service is for the most popular
Service requires faith and being full of the Holy Ghost
questions.correctAnswer: Service requires faith and being full of the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Acts 6:5 introduces Stephen as full of faith and the Holy Ghost, teaching that effective service is grounded in spiritual faith and empowerment.

questions.question: How can Acts 6 encourage believers to persevere through opposition and false accusations?
questions.correctAnswer: Ignore opposition and remain faithful
questions.explanation: Acts 6:9-10 shows Stephen facing opposition but his wisdom and Spirit could not be resisted, teaching perseverance and reliance on God's Spirit amid trials.

questions.question: What does Acts 6 reveal about the role of prayer in leadership commissioning?
options: Apostles prayed before laying hands on new servants
Commissioning should be immediate without prayer
questions.correctAnswer: Apostles prayed before laying hands on new servants
questions.explanation: Acts 6:6 shows the apostles praying before laying hands, indicating prayer's crucial role in commissioning leaders for ministry.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged because their practical service seems unnoticed. Based on Acts 6, what encouragement would you give?
options: Practical service is vital and honors God when done with faith and wisdom
Service should be stopped if unnoticed
questions.correctAnswer: Practical service is vital and honors God when done with faith and wisdom
questions.explanation: Acts 6:1-3 highlights the importance of serving widows and practical needs, showing all forms of service honor God when done with faith and wisdom.

questions.question: How does Acts 6 model the importance of unity in church life despite cultural differences?
options: Only one cultural group should serve
Different groups can serve together to maintain unity and fairness
questions.correctAnswer: Different groups can serve together to maintain unity and fairness
questions.explanation: Acts 6:1 describes murmuring between Grecians and Hebrews, leading to appointing leaders to address needs fairly, emphasizing unity in diversity.

questions.question: According to Acts 6, what is a biblical response to false accusations and slander?
options: Trust God's justice and maintain integrity
questions.correctAnswer: Trust God's justice and maintain integrity
questions.explanation: Acts 6:11-14 shows Stephen facing false accusations yet remaining faithful, teaching trust in God and integrity when accused unjustly.

questions.question: True or False: The apostles in Acts 6 believed handling daily practical needs was less important than preaching.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Acts 6:2-4 shows apostles delegating practical needs so they could focus on preaching, not that practical needs were unimportant, but that roles should be balanced.

questions.question: True or False: Stephen was described as full of faith and power, performing miracles among the people.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Acts 6:8 clearly states Stephen was full of faith and power and did great wonders and miracles, showing the Spirit's empowerment in service.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The apostles chose seven men to serve so that they could devote themselves to ______ and the ministry of the word.
questions.correctAnswer: prayer
questions.explanation: Acts 6:4 states apostles would give themselves continually to prayer and ministry of the word, delegating other tasks to serve well.

questions.question: What does the reaction of the council to Stephen's face in Acts 6:15 teach about God's presence in suffering?
options: God's presence can manifest as peace and glory even in suffering
questions.correctAnswer: God's presence can manifest as peace and glory even in suffering
questions.explanation: Acts 6:15 describes Stephen's face as like an angel's, showing God's peace and glory are with His faithful servants even under trial.

questions.question: How does Acts 6 encourage believers to maintain integrity in their work and witness?
options: By focusing on reputation and wisdom filled with the Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: By focusing on reputation and wisdom filled with the Spirit
questions.explanation: Acts 6:3-5 stresses choosing men of honest report, full of the Spirit and wisdom, encouraging integrity and Spirit-led service.

questions.question: Based on Acts 6, how should the church handle conflicts over practical matters?
options: Address them by appointing trustworthy leaders to serve
questions.correctAnswer: Address them by appointing trustworthy leaders to serve
questions.explanation: Acts 6:1-3 shows the early church resolving disputes by appointing capable men to oversee practical needs, promoting peace and order.

hard.title: Acts Chapter 6 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Acts Chapter 6.

questions.question: What was the primary reason for the murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews in Acts 6?
options: Their widows were neglected in the daily ministration
They wanted more representation in the Sanhedrin
They were jealous of the Hebrew leaders' authority
They disagreed over the teaching of the Law
questions.correctAnswer: Their widows were neglected in the daily ministration
questions.explanation: Acts 6:1 states that the murmuring arose because the widows of the Grecians were neglected in the daily distribution of food.

questions.question: What reason did the twelve apostles give for appointing seven men to serve tables?
options: It is not reason that we should leave the word of God, and serve tables
To manage the community finances better
To establish a separate Greek-speaking congregation
questions.correctAnswer: It is not reason that we should leave the word of God, and serve tables
questions.explanation: In Acts 6:2, the apostles explain that their primary mission is to focus on prayer and the ministry of the word rather than serving tables.

questions.question: According to Acts 6, what qualifications were the apostles seeking in the seven men they appointed?
options: Honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom
Experienced in temple rituals and sacrifices
Skilled in Greek rhetoric and debate
questions.correctAnswer: Honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom
questions.explanation: Acts 6:3 specifies that the men chosen were to be of honest reputation, full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom, suitable for overseeing the daily distribution work.

questions.question: Which of the following men was NOT among the seven chosen in Acts 6?
questions.correctAnswer: Barnabas
questions.explanation: Acts 6:5 lists Stephen, Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas as the seven; Barnabas is not mentioned here.

questions.question: What was the response of the multitude when the seven men were proposed?
options: The saying pleased the whole multitude
They rejected the idea and demanded apostles to serve
They wanted more than seven men appointed
They asked for a delay to pray about it
questions.correctAnswer: The saying pleased the whole multitude
questions.explanation: Acts 6:5 states that the proposal pleased the whole multitude, and they chose the seven men accordingly.

questions.question: What was the significance of the apostles laying hands on the seven chosen men?
options: It was a symbolic act of commissioning and invoking the Holy Spirit
It was a ritual to consecrate them as priests
It was a sign of disciplinary authority
It marked them as temporary deacons
questions.correctAnswer: It was a symbolic act of commissioning and invoking the Holy Spirit
questions.explanation: Acts 6:6 shows the apostles praying and laying hands on the seven, signifying their official appointment and spiritual empowerment.

questions.question: What was the effect on the early church after the appointment of the seven men?
options: The word of God increased and the number of disciples multiplied greatly
The synagogue leaders accepted the new appointments
The Grecians separated to form their own congregation
The apostles were criticized for neglecting their duties
questions.correctAnswer: The word of God increased and the number of disciples multiplied greatly
questions.explanation: Acts 6:7 records that the word of God increased, disciples multiplied, and many priests became obedient to the faith.

questions.question: Which man among the seven appointed is specifically noted for doing great wonders and miracles?
questions.correctAnswer: Stephen
questions.explanation: Acts 6:8 highlights Stephen as full of faith and power, performing great wonders and miracles among the people.

questions.question: What groups opposed Stephen in his debates according to Acts 6?
options: Synagogues of the Libertines, Cyrenians, Alexandrians, Cilicia, and Asia
questions.correctAnswer: Synagogues of the Libertines, Cyrenians, Alexandrians, Cilicia, and Asia
questions.explanation: Acts 6:9 describes opponents from various synagogues, including Libertines and others from different regions, disputing with Stephen.

questions.question: Why were Stephen's opponents unable to resist him according to Acts 6?
options: Because of the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke
Because they lacked knowledge of the Law
Because Stephen performed miracles before them
questions.correctAnswer: Because of the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke
questions.explanation: Acts 6:10 states they could not resist the wisdom and the Spirit with which Stephen spoke.

questions.question: What false accusation was made against Stephen to the council?
options: He spoke blasphemous words against Moses and God
He tried to overthrow Roman rule
He encouraged rebellion among the people
He claimed to be the Messiah himself
questions.correctAnswer: He spoke blasphemous words against Moses and God
questions.explanation: Acts 6:11 reveals that men were suborned to accuse Stephen of blasphemy against Moses and God.

questions.question: What did the false witnesses claim Stephen said about Jesus of Nazareth?
options: That Jesus would destroy the holy place and change customs delivered by Moses
That Jesus was not truly resurrected
That Jesus was a political revolutionary
That Jesus was a Roman sympathizer
questions.correctAnswer: That Jesus would destroy the holy place and change customs delivered by Moses
questions.explanation: Acts 6:14 recounts false witnesses claiming Stephen said Jesus of Nazareth would destroy the temple and change Mosaic customs.

questions.question: How did the council members perceive Stephen as he stood before them?
options: They saw his face as it had been the face of an angel
They were angered and struck him down immediately
They ignored him and dismissed the accusations
They were confused and asked for more evidence
questions.correctAnswer: They saw his face as it had been the face of an angel
questions.explanation: Acts 6:15 describes that all who sat in the council saw Stephen's face like the face of an angel, signifying divine presence or favor.

questions.question: True or False: The seven men appointed by the apostles were chosen solely for their ethnic background to resolve the dispute.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The men were selected based on their honest reputation, wisdom, and being full of the Holy Spirit, not solely on ethnic background (Acts 6:3, 6:5).

questions.question: True or False: The appointment of the seven men in Acts 6 foreshadows the later development of church offices such as deacons.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The seven appointed to serve tables are widely considered the prototype for the office of deacon in the early church, as seen in Acts 6:1-6.

theological.title: Acts Chapter 6 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Acts Chapter 6 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the primary reason for the murmuring among the Grecians against the Hebrews in Acts 6?
options: Their widows were neglected in the daily ministration
They were excluded from the synagogue
Disputes over the law of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: Their widows were neglected in the daily ministration
questions.explanation: Acts 6:1 states that the murmuring arose because the widows of the Grecians were neglected in the daily ministration. This reflects the early church’s concern for equitable care, echoing Jesus' teaching on loving one's neighbor (Mark 12:31), and the Old Testament mandate to care for widows (Exodus 22:22).

questions.question: According to Acts 6, why did the twelve apostles decide not to serve tables themselves?
options: It was not reasonable to leave the word of God to serve tables
They were too few in number
They wanted to focus on missionary journeys
questions.correctAnswer: It was not reasonable to leave the word of God to serve tables
questions.explanation: Acts 6:2 records the apostles' decision to prioritize prayer and the ministry of the word rather than serving tables, highlighting the importance of preaching and teaching (2 Timothy 4:2) and shepherding the flock (1 Peter 5:2).

questions.question: What qualifications were the apostles looking for in the seven men appointed to handle the daily distribution?
options: Men of honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom
Men skilled in debate and rhetoric
Men wealthy and influential in the community
questions.correctAnswer: Men of honest report, full of the Holy Ghost and wisdom
questions.explanation: Acts 6:3 directs the selection of men known for integrity, wisdom, and filled with the Holy Spirit, underscoring the role of the Spirit in leadership (1 Timothy 3:8-10) and the biblical emphasis on character (Proverbs 3:5-6).

questions.question: Which activity did the apostles commit themselves to continually, according to Acts 6?
options: Prayer and the ministry of the word
questions.correctAnswer: Prayer and the ministry of the word
questions.explanation: Acts 6:4 shows the apostles’ dedication to prayer and preaching, foundational practices for the early church and consistent with Jesus' example (Luke 5:16) and Paul's teachings on ministry (Colossians 4:2).

questions.question: Who was NOT among the seven men chosen in Acts 6?
questions.correctAnswer: Barnabas
questions.explanation: Acts 6:5 lists Stephen, Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas as the chosen men. Barnabas is not mentioned here but is known later as a prominent early church leader (Acts 4:36-37).

questions.question: What was the initial public effect after the appointment of the seven men in Acts 6?
options: The word of God increased and the number of disciples multiplied greatly
questions.correctAnswer: The word of God increased and the number of disciples multiplied greatly
questions.explanation: Acts 6:7 describes a significant growth in the church, demonstrating God's blessing on faithful administration and ministry, consistent with Jesus' promise that His word will not return void (Isaiah 55:11) and Paul’s teaching on growth in faith (Colossians 2:6-7).

questions.question: What specific power was Stephen described as having in Acts 6?
options: Faith and power to do great wonders and miracles
questions.correctAnswer: Faith and power to do great wonders and miracles
questions.explanation: Acts 6:8 says Stephen was full of faith and power, performing great wonders and miracles, reflecting the Holy Spirit's empowerment for ministry (Luke 24:49) and the apostolic signs that authenticated the gospel (Hebrews 2:3-4).

questions.question: Against whom did certain members of the synagogue dispute with Stephen?
questions.correctAnswer: Stephen himself
questions.explanation: Acts 6:9 indicates that members of various synagogues disputed with Stephen, targeting him specifically due to his teaching and miracles, highlighting early opposition to the gospel (John 15:18-20) and fulfillment of Jesus’ warning about persecution (Matthew 10:22).

questions.question: Why could Stephen’s opponents not resist him, according to Acts 6?
options: Because of the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke
Because he was supported by Roman soldiers
Because he had written many scrolls
questions.correctAnswer: Because of the wisdom and the Spirit by which he spoke
questions.explanation: Acts 6:10 explains Stephen’s opponents could not withstand his wisdom and Spirit, showing divine empowerment in apologetics and teaching, consistent with Christ’s promise of the Spirit to guide believers (John 16:13) and Paul’s description of Spirit-led speech (1 Corinthians 2:4).

questions.question: What false accusation was made against Stephen by suborned men?
options: He spoke blasphemous words against Moses and God
He stole from the temple treasury
questions.correctAnswer: He spoke blasphemous words against Moses and God
questions.explanation: Acts 6:11 records the accusation that Stephen blasphemed Moses and God, a charge reflecting the common tactic of opponents to discredit Christian leaders, paralleling false accusations against Jesus (Mark 14:57-58) and Paul (Acts 24:5).

questions.question: Who was stirred up against Stephen leading to his arrest?
questions.correctAnswer: The people, elders, and scribes
questions.explanation: Acts 6:12 tells how the people, elders, and scribes were stirred up against Stephen, showing the widespread official opposition, consistent with the rejection faced by prophets in Israel (Jeremiah 20:2) and Jesus Himself (Matthew 26:3).

questions.question: What false testimony was set up against Stephen in the council?
options: That he spoke blasphemous words against the holy place and the law
That he refused to pay temple taxes
That he was a Roman spy
questions.correctAnswer: That he spoke blasphemous words against the holy place and the law
questions.explanation: Acts 6:13 records false witnesses claiming Stephen blasphemed the temple and the law, reflecting attempts to undermine the gospel by appealing to religious nationalism, similar to accusations against Jesus (John 2:19-21) and Paul (Acts 21:28).

questions.question: What did the false witnesses claim Stephen said about Jesus of Nazareth?
options: That Jesus would destroy the temple and change the customs Moses delivered
That Jesus was a false prophet
That Jesus was a Roman collaborator
questions.correctAnswer: That Jesus would destroy the temple and change the customs Moses delivered
questions.explanation: Acts 6:14 reports the accusation that Stephen claimed Jesus would destroy the temple and change Mosaic customs, a charge echoing fears about Jesus’ messianic claims (Matthew 21:12-13) and the transformative nature of the gospel (Hebrews 8:13).

questions.question: How was Stephen’s appearance described as he stood before the council?
options: His face was like the face of an angel
questions.correctAnswer: His face was like the face of an angel
questions.explanation: Acts 6:15 states that Stephen’s face appeared like an angel’s, indicating divine presence and favor in the face of persecution, reminiscent of Moses’ radiance (Exodus 34:29-30) and Jesus’ transfiguration (Luke 9:29).

questions.question: What theological insight about the early church’s structure can be drawn from the appointment of the seven men?
options: The church distinguishes roles to ensure both word ministry and practical service
All believers are to perform all ministries equally
Only apostles should lead and serve tables
The church rejects the role of deacons
questions.correctAnswer: The church distinguishes roles to ensure both word ministry and practical service
questions.explanation: Acts 6:2-4 shows the apostles appointing seven men to serve practical needs so that the apostles can focus on prayer and the word. This reflects the biblical principle of diverse gifts and roles within the body of Christ (Ephesians 4:11-12; 1 Corinthians 12:12-27).
